item.title: The Plaintext Truth About Password Storage Vulnerabilties
item.description: It seems every few months a major site has their user database compromised one way or another. Gwaker, LinkedIn, and last.fm among others have been attacked, having their user’s login credentials and other data posted online for the world to see. How this happened is an after thought, with near certainty I can say that any information stored on a computer connected to a network will at some point be compromised.
